column1: Local Foods////The food is pretty consistent and the staff is usually pretty on point. I was upset about a particular event that occurred when we ordered hummus with vegetables. A guest from our party met up with us late and asked for a few pieces of bread. The staff was very friendly and kindly brought it over. Then
column2: a man who didn't identify himself came over a few minutes later to ask if we paid for the bread. We said no
column3: but we could if we needed to. He said yes
column6: and charged one dollar on it. He brought us the receipt with a menu and pointed out the price difference after we had already paid for it. Making a big deal over something so trivial isn't really a way to run a successful business.
